stories.title: What Would It Take to Manufacture Perovskite Solar Cells in Space?

stories.text:
I'm trying to reduce the services/apps I pay for, and one of the easy ones to lose (I think) is my time tracking app. As a freelancer, I have realised I really don't need to be putting my time into Harvest, because all I ever enter is what was in my Google Calendar in the first place.

So I figure if I can get my calendar data into a database (like Notion) or even just a spreadsheet, i'm home and hosed. I've found a lot of the automation services like automate.io or Zapier would require me to pay for a subscription to do the amount of automation required to get the job done, and i've also discovered that while there are add ons to Google Calendar and Google Sheets that can carry data across, I haven't found them to be reliable in my testing.

So - i'd love tips on the simplest possible way to do this.

My setup is - each project has it's own calendar under my Google Workspace calendar account. I would then tally up the calendar time blocks on a given calendar when it's time to invoice that client. Simple as that. Or it will be - once I figure out a simple and reliable way to do it.

Thanks!
stories.title: What's the simplest way to get Google Calendar data into a database/spreadsheet?
